content.text: Write down the value of the 5 in the number 0.25 .
Give your answer as a fraction.
Find the value of the reciprocal of 0.25 .
Write down the mathematical name for an angle between \(90^{\circ}\) and \(180^{\circ}\).
Write down the mathematical term that describes two polygons that are the same shape and size.
(a) Write down the mathematical name for this quadrilateral.
The diagram shows a quadrilateral with sides of equal length.
Find the next term in each sequence.
The longest phone call is 75 minutes.
These are the lengths of time, in minutes, of seven phone calls.
70 students study one of French, Spanish and German.
The ratio number who study French : number who study Spanish \(= 3:7\). 15 students study French.
Find the number of students who study German.
The dimensions of the cuboid are ........ cm by ........ cm by ........ cm.
On the grid, complete a net of the cuboid.
Work out the volume of the cuboid.
The diagram shows two faces of a net of a cuboid on a \(1 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\) grid.
Calculate the surface area of the pyramid.
Write down the number of edges of the square-based pyramid.
The diagram shows the net of a square-based pyramid.
The perpendicular height of each triangle is 4 cm. The base has side length 5 cm.
Draw a ring around the description that is correct.
On the grid, draw the graph of \(y=2x-1\).
Draw this sector on the pie chart.
Work out the size of the sector angle for jazz.
9 people prefer jazz and the rest prefer folk.
Jo asks 90 people whether they prefer pop, rock, classical, jazz or folk music. The pie chart shows some of the results.
Use this information to complete the Venn diagram.
\(7\) members play a flute \((F)\) and play a clarinet \((C)\).
\(1\) member does not play a flute and does not play a clarinet.
By writing each number in the calculation correct to 1 significant figure, find an estimate for the value of
The diagram shows a trapezium. The area of the trapezium is \(42 \mathrm{~cm}^{2}\).
(a) Write down the inequality represented on the number line.
Write down the smallest integer that satisfies the inequality \(d> -3 \frac{1}{4}\).
On Monday the cost of a concert ticket is \(\$ x\).
On Tuesday the cost of a ticket for the same concert is \(20 \%\) more than the cost on Monday.
Jack buys 4 tickets on Monday and 5 tickets on Tuesday.
Give a geometrical reason for your answer.
The diagram shows a sector of a circle with radius 3 cm and sector angle \(60^{\circ}\) .
Calculate the area of the sector.
Give your answer in terms of \(\pi\) in its simplest form.
20 Find the highest common factor (HCF) of 36 and 54.
The perimeter of the triangle is equal to the perimeter of the rectangle.
Form an equation and solve it to find the value of \(x\).
The diagram shows a circle, centre \(O\).
\(P\) and \(S\) are points on the circle.
\(QRST\) is a tangent to the circle at \(S\).
21 In this question, all lengths are in centimetres.
Rearrange the formula to make \(h\) the subject.
Rectangle \(A\) is mathematically similar to rectangle \(B\).
Give your answer as a mixed number in its simplest form.
